creator: anurag_gujral@yahoo.com
text:
As per  below ticket
https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=44783

There was memory issue with rotatelogs which got fixed earlier this year.
I have started seeing this problem recently.
I am currently using httpd-2.0.59 ,I want to change the rotatelogs binaries to 
the new binary is it okay to only upgrade to  rotatelogs which comes with  httpd-2.2.10  without upgrading the full package i.e I just want to 
upgrade the rotatelogs

Plz comment thanks.

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
Bugzilla is for bug reporting, not questions. 

Try the users list: http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html
Yes you can. Provided that you also install apr-1.3 on your system and compile your logrotate against it.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
